items.name: Bethesda Terrace
items.funFact: Bethesda Terrace is the only underground section of Central Park and features stunning architecture.

items.name: Bow Bridge
items.funFact: Bow Bridge is one of the most photographed bridges in Central Park and was built in 1862.

items.name: Sheep Meadow
items.funFact: Sheep Meadow was historically used to graze sheep, giving it its unique name and open landscape.

items.name: Strawberry Fields
items.funFact: Strawberry Fields is a memorial garden dedicated to John Lennon of The Beatles.

items.name: Balto Statue
items.funFact: The Balto statue commemorates the sled dog who helped deliver medicine during the 1925 serum run.

items.name: Bethesda Fountain
items.funFact: Bethesda Fountain is the only fountain in Central Park with a statue at its top.

items.name: Conservatory Garden
items.funFact: The Conservatory Garden is the only formal garden in Central Park with three distinct sections.

items.name: Turtle Pond
items.funFact: Turtle Pond is home to red-eared slider turtles and various fish species.

items.name: Belvedere Castle
items.funFact: Belvedere Castle offers panoramic views of Central Park and was built in 1869.
